channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.description:
#Jasper Reports

##Number format for excel sheets TextField -> Advanced -> Properties -> Pattern #,##0 vagy #,##0.00

##Formatting part of a text field

#Java

##Command line tools - jps -l - lists JVM processes - jcmd <PID> <command> send diagnostic commands to a JVM - VM.flags: list extra VM flags - VM.command_line: arguments that the VM started with
- jstat - monitor VM statistics - jmap -dump:file=<FILE> <PID> - dump heap statistics

#Linux

##SSH - ssh -C -D 12345 tm1032@ural2.hszk.bme.hu - -C: compress - -D: creates dynamic proxy

##GRUB After installing Ubuntu, GRUB didn’t show, just a puprle screen. Booted a live disk, and edited /etc/default/grub. Set GRUB_GFXMODE=640x480 and then sudo update-grub

##Locale http://www.dedoimedo.com/computers/ubuntu-family-locale.html

##X - Adding new resolutions: http://sammart.in/2012/05/29/enabling-resolutions-in-ubuntu-12-04-lubuntu-12-04/ - Mouse gets stuck between monitors: http://askubuntu.com/questions/109338/how-do-i-disable-mouse-magnet-on-middle-edge-with-multi-monitors - Load indicator: http://www.webupd8.org/2011/05/network-memory-and-cpu-usage-indicator.html#more

##Curl - Sending host header: curl --verbose --header 'Host: www.example.com' 'http://10.1.1.36:8000/the_url_to_test'

##UFW - ufw allow from 10.29.1.0/24 to any port 8000:8100 proto tcp

#Editing this repo

I use MarkdownEditing to edit this repo using markdown files.

To get the dark theme to work I downloaded the theme file from the repo and put it into ~/.config/sublime-text-3/MarkdownEditor-Dark.tmTheme. Then I set up the settings file as described in the MarkdownEditor repo.

After installing I set up Sublime Text using View->Syntax->Open all with current extension as…/MarkdownEditor/Markdown GFM

#Foreign key error While adding a foreign key, I’ve got a cryptic ‘alter table failed’ error. All the data types matched, the reason was that the collation of the two varchar columns wasn’t the same.

#Configuring mysqld * When configuring use mysqld --help --verbose to list options that the server would start with * By default, mysql doesn’t allow root to connect with password. To allow this, enter a mysql shell with sudo mysql -u root and issue the following:

USE mysql;
UPDATE user SET authentication_string = PASSWORD(''), password_expired = 'N', plugin = 'mysql_native_password' WHERE user = 'root';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

*If somehow you lock yourself out with your root account, mysqld may be started up without authentication: sudo /usr/sbin/mysqld --skip-grant-tables --skip-networking
